abstract.p: Barbara Aronowitz letter disagrees with Bill Desowitz's Dec 12 (1999) article on film characterizations (S)

block.p: In the article ''Finding Spiritual Rebirth in a Valley of Male Ennui'' [Dec. 12], Bill Desowitz compared Kevin Spacey's character in ''American Beauty'' to Emily from Thornton Wilder's ''Our Town.'' I can grasp the similarity of themes between the two works, but I disagree with Mr. Desowitz's analysis. Emily appreciated life while she lived it; she was bewildered by her life after death. She excelled in school, fell in love and was proud of the work she and her husband had done on the farm.

In the article ''Finding Spiritual Rebirth in a Valley of Male Ennui'' [Dec. 12], Bill Desowitz compared Kevin Spacey's character in ''American Beauty'' to Emily from Thornton Wilder's ''Our Town.'' I can grasp the similarity of themes between the two works, but I disagree with Mr. Desowitz's analysis. Emily appreciated life while she lived it; she was bewildered by her life after death. She excelled in school, fell in love and was proud of the work she and her husband had done on the farm.
The character who experienced hopelessness in ''Our Town'' was Simon Stimson, who committed suicide. He had no appreciation for life before or after his death.
